TopicTitle: Contract wants "Altitude on surface". What scientific equipment do I use for that?

Articles.Content: A crew report didn't do the job like I thought it would.  But on an airless moon a barometer didn't seem appropriate either so I didn't bother with one

I think "altitude on surface" is referring to the location that the contract requires your active vessel to be. Meaning it requires you to be parked on the surface at the time of a specific action. What is the action it's asking you to do? Or what does the rest of the contract say?

Just now, InfernoSD said:

I think "altitude on surface" is referring to the location that the contract requires your active vessel to be. Meaning it requires you to be parked on the surface at the time of a specific action. What is the action it's asking you to do? Or what does the rest of the contract say?

OMG.  I need to pay better attention.  You are correct, they are temperature readings <facepalm>
